an5.294-302:1.1: Taking _māgaṇḍika_ as derived from the Dravidian _mā_ (“black”) and _gaṇḍa_ (“hero”), and hence an example of the Dark Hermit archetype. See also Asita Kaṇhasiri (or Kāladevala, [snp3.11:1.1]()), Asita Devala ([mn93:18.6]()), Kaṇha ([dn3:1.23.6]()), Kaṇhadīpāyana ([cp31:1.2]()), and Sāma ([cp33:1.1]()). Alternatively, _mā_ could mean “great”, making this a Dravidian equivalent to Mahāvīra.
